alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 4:33AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall that occurred on Friday. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Elbert and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 930 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways and several roads are closed. Some low-water crossings may be impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 AM MDT, Additional thunderstorms will increase the risk of flash flooding this afternoon. A Flash Flood Watch is in effect for Elbert and Lincoln counties from Noon to 6 PM MDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Limon, Hugo, Arriba, Genoa, Punkin Center, Boyero, Kutch, Matheson and Cedar Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
